items.summary:
Over at Amazon, through the official Woot storefront, you can currently pick up the Ninja FrostVault 45-quart Wheeled Cooler at $229.99 shipped. It’s coming down from $300 here, which we’ve previously seen go as low as $236 on Amazon back during July’s Prime Day event, while Black Friday and Christmas sales only saw it fall to $250. While we have seen it go lower at other retailers, particularly bargain-bin sites, you’re still looking at a solid 23% markdown that cuts $70 off the tag, making it a far more affordable score if you don’t have the money to pick up an electric cooler/freezer like the Anker SOLIX EverFrost 2 options.

items.title: Segway’s E3 Pro is my go-to e-scooter with 34-mile range, Apple Find My, more at second-best $550 pricing
items.summary:
Segway is currently offering its E3 Pro Electric Scooter at $549.99 shipped, which is also matching in price over at Amazon, too. While it is listed with a $700 MSRP direct from the brand, we’ve been seeing it hold out more often at $600 there, while starting at that rate over at Amazon. Discounts have been rarer and rarer since tariffs began weighing heavier on the American market in 2025, though we did last see it fall lower back during Black Friday when it hit its $500 low. If you missed out on that price, you’re getting the next-best rate here while these savings last, giving you $50 off the going rate (and $150 off the MSRP) for an e-scooter that has become my new go-to since going hands-on in our review last year. There are a few other models seeing varying discounts in the brand’s Amazon storefront here, while others are seeing their usual discounted rates offered direct from the brand’s website here.

more…

Back at the start of the year, Velotric announced five new e-bikes that would be joining its lineup throughout 2026, and the brand is now offering early-bird perks on the first two models. Through the rest of the week until February 9, you can sign up on the brand’s main page here to score these early rewards on the Discover 3 Commuter e-bike and the Discover M Mid-Drive e-bike, giving you $348 savings that will be free to use starting February 10, 2026, once the code is emailed to you. This deal gives you an extended 1-year care plan alongside the new Lumos Ultra helmet (valued together at $348), but you won’t want to sleep on this chance if you plan to jump on these upgraded models through the month and into March. Head below to get a rundown on what we know about these upcoming models.

items.title: Update – Live again: Nintendo Virtual Boy hardware now up for purchase
items.summary:
Update: The new Virtual Boy hardware is now available for purchase directly from Nintendo for Switch Online members. “This product can be purchased by those who have a paid Nintendo Switch Online membership. To play games in the Virtual Boy – Nintendo Classics, you will need an active Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack membership. The Nintendo Switch Lite is not compatible.”

During today’s lengthy Nintendo Direct, we did not get any updates on the Switch Online GameCube library, but Nintendo did officially announce Virtual Boy! It is ready to add an entirely new console to its Nintendo Classics collection in the form of the ultra-retro Virtual Boy library alongside an actual Virtual Boy peripheral you stick your Switch or Switch 2 inside of. Details below.
